H0.text: Amplitude is the property that increases as the loudness of a sound wave increases.

H1.text: Frequency will also increase as the loudness of a sound wave increases.

H2.text: Velocity also increases as the loudness of a sound wave increases.

H3.text: Wavelength increases as the loudness of a sound wave increases.

A4.text: The perception of loudness is related to sound pressure level (SPL), frequency content and duration of a sound.

A5.text: The sensitivity of the human ear changes as a function of frequency, as shown in the equal-loudness graph.
